CA Smart Tracker 1.0 Online Help



About CA Smart Tracker 1.0

CA Smart Tracker 1.0 is a tracking, notifying and alerting software that can be used by the CA bus commuters who own Android devices. It works in a collaborative way, where all the commuters who use this product form a community. It enables all the CA bus commuters to:

  • Broadcast the location of their buses.

  • Track the locations of all their buses.

  • Receive administrative notifications from the CA facilities.

  • Send alerts to concerned members against an imminent danger.

Note: CA Smart Tracker 1.0 runs only on Android devices with OS version 4.2.x or higher. The devices must have Wi-Fi and internet connectivity.

How it Works?

CA Smart Tracker 1.0 consists of a client application called Smart Tracker. You must install this application on your Android device. When you install the Smart Tracker you become a member of the Smart Tracker community. After installing the Smart Tracker, you can broadcast, track; send notifications and alerts for all the commuters.

Before starting the Smart Tracker you must connect to the Wi-Fi device in your CA bus. Your device sends its location coordinates and the route details through the Wi-Fi to the Smart Tracker Server (STS). The STS runs in the public domain. When you enable the “Broadcast” feature on the Smart tracker, your device starts posting its location coordinates to the STS periodically. A commuter who wants to track the location of your bus uses the “Track” feature to track. The Track feature polls the STS through the internet to obtain the location of your bus.

Note: Members of the Smart Tracker community must enable the broadcast feature on their devices. At least one Smart Tracker member must enable the Broadcast feature to enable a commuter to track a bus.

Features

When you start the Smart Tracker, it displays the following four features on the screen of your device.

Broadcast

Click Broadcast to start broadcasting the location of your bus. It is a toggle UI button, first click enables the Broadcast feature and second click disables it.

Each broadcast enabled device sends its location details in the <Latitude><Longitude><Route#> format to the STS. As a result, when commuters start broadcasting in their CA bus, Smart Tracker members can detect the location of their respective CA Route buses.

Note: When more than one member broadcasts, the tracking commuter gets the latest coordinates.

Track

Click Track to track of your CA bus. When you click Track, a list of all the bus route numbers is displayed. Select your Route bus to find its location. The location of your route bus is shown in the Google map.

Note: If you want to track your route bus, at least one member traveling in your route bus must enable the broadcast feature. In case nobody traveling in your route bus broadcasts, you will not see your route bus in the track list.

Escort

Click Escort to send an alert message to a configured destination when you are expecting an imminent danger. It is a toggle UI button, first click enables the Escort feature and second click disables it. This feature enables female commuters to send an alert message, and also post their location for tracking purpose.

Enable the Escort feature while traveling, and shake your device in suspicious circumstances. Once you shake your device an alert message is sent to the configured destination.

Notifications

Click Notifications to see any notifications that are sent to you by the CA facilities.

Track:

Displays list of all routes available with location information. Select desired location see the current location of the bus.

The selected route will be shown in Google maps. You may change the preference to show all ways your default bus route location in maps

eScort is a feature which helps in emergency to protect women employees of CA. Enable this mode when you want send distress signal in emergency to the security dept. it does not require user to unlock the phone and click on any buttons in emergency but it just activates by shaking your device in a pattern.

It will automatically send SMS to pre configured contact numbers, send emergency signal to security message central, makes a call to 1 pre configured number and also makes a loud noise to make others aorund you alert about it.

Please configure your emergency contact information from settings page.

Notifications:

You will be subscribed to 1 or more messaging channels(route info channels) to get notified by Facilities/Admin Dept. with emergency notifications. You will be able to see all the notifications pushed from facilities/Admin/security Dept. from here.

Please use options available in settings to configure your notification channels. You can subscribe to all the channels.
